Weaning is the process of gradually introducing a mammal infant to what will be 
its adult diet and withdrawing the supply of its mother's milk. The process takes 
place only in mammals, as only mammals produce milk. The infant is considered 
to be fully weaned once it is no longer fed any breast milk (or bottled substitute). 
... recommends feeding a baby only breast milk for the first six months of its life.
